item.title: Jason add a quote by Charles Spurgeon
item.description: "Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal, and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom." -- Charles Spurgeon

item.title: Jason add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jason add a quote by Francis Chan
item.description: "Our greatest fear should not be of failure but of succeeding at things in life that don't really matter." -- Francis Chan

item.title: Jason add a quote by Paul Brandt
item.description: "Don't tell me the sky's the limit when there are footprints on the moon." -- Paul Brandt

item.title: Jason add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "Education is a system of imposed ignorance." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Jason add a quote by Joe Abercrombie
item.description: "Travel brings wisdom only to the wise. It renders the ignorant more ignorant than ever." -- Joe Abercrombie

item.title: Jason add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Jason add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Jason add a quote by Eoin Colfer
item.description: "Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know." -- Eoin Colfer

item.title: Jason add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your <i>informed</i> opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Jason add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Fear always springs from ignorance." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jason add a quote by Dan Simmons
item.description: "The shortest route to courage is absolute ignorance." -- Dan Simmons

item.title: Jason add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "originality and a feeling of one's own dignity are achieved only through work and struggle." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Jason add a quote by Francis Chan
item.description: "It is true that God may have called you to be exactly where you are. But, it is absolutely vital to grasp that he didnâ€™t call you there so you could settle in and live your life in comfort and superficial peace." -- Francis Chan

item.title: Jason add a quote by Francis Chan
item.description: "Something is wrong when our lives make sense to unbelievers." -- Francis Chan

item.title: Jason add a quote by Francis Chan
item.description: "The world needs Christians who don't tolerate the complacency of their own lives." -- Francis Chan

item.title: Jason add a quote by Francis Chan
item.description: "[Y]ou have to stop loving and pursuing Christ in order to sin. When you are pursuing love, running toward Christ, you do not have opportunity to wonder, *Am I doing this right?* or *Did I serve enough this week?* When you are running toward Christ, you are freed up to serve, love, and give thanks without guilt, worry or fear. As long as you are running, you're safe." -- Francis Chan

item.title: Jason add a quote by Francis Chan
item.description: "We don't get to decide who God is." -- Francis Chan
